Bookmarks Menu

Bellingcat

Image/Video

Reverse Image Search

Google Lens / Desktop - Google Lens but in your browser - it's better than Google Image reverse search
InVID-WeVerify - Verification plugin to help journalists verify images and videos. Contextual data, Metadata, reverse search (Google, Yandex, Baidu), image forensic, Magnifier). @WeVerify on Twitter
KarmaDecay - Reverse search images on Reddit
RootAbout - Reverse search images on the Internet Archive
VGG Image Search Engine (VISE) - This standalone application can be used to do a reverse image search on a large collection of images

Shadow Analysis

SunCalc.org - Make an approximation of the time of the day using shadow direction
Using the Sun and Shadows for Geolocation

Metadata

ExifPurge - EXIF Purge is a small portable application to remove EXIF metadata from multiple images at once. With the click of a button you can remove the camera, location and other technical information from a batch of photos which is embedded by the camera or the photo editing software
Forensically Image Forensics - Web-based image forensics tool. Can easily identify fake or doctored images. Public access, information not private
FotoForensics - Image forensics tool
Irfanview - Windows-based software to extract metadata
jhead - Remove EXIF/metadata
Jimpl - Online EXIF data viewer
metadata2go - Check metadata for both photos and videos online
Reveal Image Verification Assistant - Forensic providing eight filters to detect still images alterations. - Web-based image tool. Also available within InVID verification plugin
SpiderPig - Github - Extract metadata. Command line interface and scriptable. Requires dependencies and knowledge of web technologies
Splunk - Extract metadata. Report grade analysis and presentation. Not simple to setup and deploy

Facial Recognition

Amazon Rekognition - Check how similar two faces are
PimEyes - Face Search Engine & Reverse Image Search
Search4Faces - Search a database of 84 million TikTok accounts
VGG Face Finder (VFF) Engine - Visual Geometry Group and released under the BSD-2 clause. VFF is a web application that serves as a web engine to perform searches for faces over an user-defined image dataset. It is based on the original application created by VGG to perform visual searchers over a large dataset of images from BBC News

Face Restoration Tool

GFPGAN - Practical face restoration algorithm for old photos or AI-generated faces

Image Classification

VGG Image Classification (VIC) Engine - The VGG Image Classification (VIC) Engine is an open source project developed at the Visual Geometry Group and released under the BSD-2 clause. VIC is a web application that serves as a web engine to perform image classification queries over an user-defined image dataset. It is based on the original application created by VGG to perform visual searchers over a large dataset of images from BBC News

Image Organization

PureRef - Image workspace; lets you arrange images in groups, organize them, etc

Image Editor (Object Removal)

Cleanup.Pictures - Web tool for quickly removing objects from an image

GAN Detector

AmIReal - Github - detects if faces were generated by ThisPersonDoesNotExist

Miscellaneous

fdupes - Github - Locating exact matches of duplicate files
RenRot - Github - Attempts to rename image filenames to their original name, and rotate them to the original orientation

YouTube

YouTube Geofind - Allows you to search for YouTube videos by coordinates rather than keywords

IPVM Calculator - Tool for simulating camera views (for geolocations)

Social Media

Multiple

Phantombuster - No-code tool to easily scrape / automatically extract info from all kinds of social media (aimed at marketeers). Be aware you'll have to log-in and share data with a company
SMAT - Disinformation tracker. Works by pulling data from Gab, Parler, 4chan, 8kun, .win, poal, telegram, Gettr, Bitchute, Tiktok
snscrape - Comand-line tool for scraping multiple social media platforms without using official API, especially Twitter and Telegram
Social-searcher - Search hashtags and names across various platforms

Clubhouse

ClubhouseDB - Search users, number of followers/following, and date of registry
Search4Faces - Reverse-search a face in about 5m clubhouse avatars

Discord

Disboard - Search for public discord servers
DiscordLeaks - Search hundreds of thousands of messages leaked from 180+ white-supremacist / nazi discord servers, by UnicornRiot

Facebook

Facebook Live Map - Live broadcasts around the world
Facebook Video Downloader - Handy website to download public Facebook videos. Copy paste the URL of the video and download it in the available definition formats
HaveIBeenZuckered - Check if a telephone number is present within the Facebook data breach
new-fb-search - GitHub - so you'll have to know how to use that
Skopenow - Social Media Investigations - name, phone, email, name searches
Sleep Stats - GitHub - Track user sleeping habits
Sowdust FB search / graph.tips/beta - This page tries to be a simple interface to show how the current Facebook search function works, after Graph search was closed
Who posted what? - Find posts on Facebook

Gab

SMAT-app / Gab - Search messages, count links, see activity & timeline

Gettr

SMAT-app / Gettr - Search messages, count links, see activity & timeline

Google

Google Account Finder (EPIEOS) - Find the profile picture and public Google Map Reviews + Photos associated with a G-mail adress. Also checks for phone numbers, and checks for email addresses on social networks

Gravatar

Email Checker - Check if an email address has been used to comment on blogs and whether there is a profile image attached

Instagram

InstaLoader - GitHub - scrape information from public accounts. Does not use the official API, and allows downloading pictures and videos along with their captions and other metadata from Instagram. Similar to twint for Twitter
StorySaver - Download public Instagram Stories, Highlights and Videos

LinkedIn

Email to LinkedIn (Epieos) - Check if an email address is connected to a LinkedIn Profile
LinkedIn Overlay Remover - Removes the overlay that displays over a linkedin profile

Minecraft

NameMC - Find names, track name changes

Parler

Parler Video Uploads Map - A map showing the approximate (100ft) location of where Parler videos have been uploaded
SMAT-app / Parler - Search messages, count links, see activity & timeline

Playstation

PSNprofiles - Search name, see daily activity, games played, country, and profile pic

Reddit

F5Bot - Sends you an email when a keyword is mentioned on Reddit
KarmaDecay - Reverse image search for Reddit
Redective - Analyse Reddit profiles - incl word frequency and active hours

Snapchat

Snap Map - Searchable map of geotagged snaps. - [Here’s how you download a Snap. -](https://map.snapchat.com/)

Steam

SteamId.uk - Lookup player names, view (more) previously used names, and when accounts befriended eachother (Free). View screenshots of account, (bulk) seach based on previously used names (paid)

Telegram

Bellingcat Phonenumber Check - Github - check whether a specific phone number is connected to a Telegram account
Geogramint - Github - Find Telegram groups and users near a geographical location
Intelligence X: TG - Google-based search engine for Telegram (includes Telegago)
Telegago - Google-based search engine for Telegram
TelegramDB - Database of Telegram channels
Telemetr.io - Telegram channel analytics
How to Archive Telegram Content to Document Russia's Invasion of Ukraine
Telepathy - GitHub - "swiss army knife" for investigating Telegram chats
TGstat - Searches archived Telegram channels and provides channel analytics
tlgrm.eu/channels - Search Telegram channels

TikTok

Bellingcat TikTok # Analysis - Github - Bellingcat built - Helps to download posts and videos from TikTok for a given set of hashtags over a period of time
This New Tool Lets You Analyse TikTok Hashtags
Bellingcat TikTok Date Extract - Get the exact upload date + time for tiktok video urls - [How to Investigate TikTok Like a Pro - Part II: Using TikTok for Ukraine Research -](https://bellingcat.github.io/tiktok-timestamp/)
Search4Faces - Search a databaes of 84 million TikTok accounts
TikTok Downloader - Extension - Download TikTok videos. Doesn't work for some videos, unclear why. - [Bellingcat Tiktok Guide -](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/tiktok-downloader/blbckhiepgpniilpmlionnkjoeehhgao)
TikTokApi - Python - This is an unofficial api wrapper for TikTok.com in python. With this api you are able to call most trending and fetch specific user information as well as much more

Twitter

Hoaxy - Visualize the spread of claims and factchecking
InVID verification plugin - InVID plugin provides a Twitter advanced search by time interval up to the minute. Allows documenting use cases from the past without APIs and time limit. Allows searching for content within a user-defined time range after a breaking news
Onemilliontweetmap - Tweets map per locations up to 6 hours old, keyword search option
Spoonbill - Check for changes made to a Twitter account's status (i.e., bio, pinned tweets, location, etc.)
t - command-line power tool for Twitter (it is an open source command line script written in Ruby). Highly flexible, can be put in Bash scripts to automate Twitter activity and searches. Deeper search through REST API. Output spreadsheets/CSV. Fast performance for bulk operations
Treeverse - Extension - visualise Twitter conversations
Twitter advanced search - Search by date, keywords, etc
Twitter Follower Collector - Scrapes any account's Twitter followers
Twitter List Copy - Copy public Twitter lists into your own existing lists
Twitter Video Downloader - Download Twitter videos
TwitterAudit - Check bots
Twlets - Download anyone’s tweets, followers and likes in an Excel sheet. Easy and quick to use, there’s a Chrome extension too
Geofenced Searches on Twitter: A Case Study Detailing South Asia’s Covid Crisis
Memory Lol - Github - Provide historical information about social media accounts. Historical screen names for 443 million Twitter accounts

Vkontakte

Bellingcat VK Scraper - Github - scrape data, and especially media links like videos and photos, from vk.com URLs
FindClone - Searches images from VK profiles (within certain limits)
Search4Faces - Upload a facepic, find similar on VKontakte (also searches Odnoklassniki)
Vk.watch - See public comments left by an account, profile photos used, and very basic facial recognition

WhatsApp

WAtools.io - Track whatsapp activity, number, profile picture

Xbox

XboxGamertag - Search gamertags, see games played and recorded game clips

YouTube

Amnesty YouTube Dataviewer - Reverse image (video still) search and exact uploading time.
Here’s an Advanced Guide on Verifying Video Content
YouTube Geofind - YouTube Geofind; three different search functions, location, topic, and channel
YouTube location-based search - Location-based search on YouTube, but it's unclear whether it shows where it was uploaded, from which server, or only filters on keywords (e.g. “Paris” in title shows up in Paris)
YouTube Metadata - An alternative to Amnesty's YT viewer, with slightly more information
youtube-dl - Python tool to download from a variety of sources. Select video / audio formats, quality etc. Updated frequently to support parsing the relevant sources (alternate link: youtube-dl.org)

4chan

4plebs - Searchable archive of specific 4chan boards. Makes it possible to read threads after they are purged from 4chan

8chan/8kun

Open Measures - Search messages, count links, see activity & timeline

People (Phone, Email, Name)

Phone

Non-US

South Africa: Person Lookup - find individuals, phone numbers, and addresses
NigeriaPhonebook - Look up by name, state, and phone number. Last names are partially censored for free accounts. - Nigeria
Arab-Speaking World: MenoM3ay - Caller ID service (mobile app)
Eniro - Yellow Pages (Swedish Edition)
Hitta - Look up phone numbers/names
UK: 192.com - Searching for someone's address in the UK, phone number and who they live with according to electoral rolls.

FastPeopleSearch - Mostly good for US.
GetContact - Phonenumber ID app - draws from crowdsourced contactbooks - Do not give permission to your actual contact lists
Have I Been Pwned? - Does email or phone appear in data breaches?
Pipl - Identity information for professionals
Search Systems - Finding public record information online in over 70,000 databases organized by type and location to help you find property, criminal, court, birth, death, marriage, divorce records, licenses, deeds, mortgages, corporate records, business registration, and many other public record resources.
Spokeo - People search through email, phone, name
ThisNumber - An international directory of white pages and yellow pages phone books, and online directory enquiries. It's a free, independent and up-to-date guide to telephone directories on the web
TrueCaller - App that gathers phonenumbers and names from contact lists. - Do not give permission to your actual contact lists
Watools.io - Tools for whatsapp: Check if number is used, download profile pic, check online status
Worldwide Osint Tools map - Global overview of yellow/white pages, court cases, business registries etc

Email

Email Reputation - How trustworthy is an email, is it a throwaway etc
Have I Been Pwned? - Does email or phone appear in data breaches?
Epieos (Check Email Usage) - Checks where an email has been used. Based on Holehe. - Registration required
Pipl - Identity information for professionals
Spokeo - People search through email, phone, name

Name

Bellingcat Name Variant Search - Simple tool to help search for different ways of writing a name
Blackbird - Check names on 574 websites and social networks - [Easy to use web interface on this website -](https://github.com/p1ngul1n0/blackbird)
Check Names - Check names on 160 social networks - Not very reliable
FastPeopleSearch - Mostly good for US. - mostly United States
Hitta - Look up phone numbers/names (Sweden) - Sweden
Law Pages - Search criminal court case details in the UK, such as sentence, hearing, defendant, etc. - United Kingdom
Namecheck - Name and domain check website. Easy to see on which platforms a single name has been used. Many mismatches
Netherlands Name Register - Find out how common a name is in the Netherlands based on census data - The Netherlands
NigeriaPhonebook - Look up by name, state, and phone number. Last names are partially censored for free accounts. - Nigeria
Person Lookup - find individuals, phonenumbers, and adresses - South Africa
Pipl - Identity information for professionals
Search Systems - Finding public record information online in over 70,000 databases organized by type and location to help you find property, criminal, court, birth, death, marriage, divorce records, licenses, deeds, mortgages, corporate records, business registration, and many other public record resources. - US
Sherlock - Check names on 300 websites and social networks
Spokeo - People search through email, phone, name
Swedish Name Register - Find out how common a name is in Sweden based on census data - Sweden
Whats My Name - Search name on 270+ platforms
Worldwide Osint Tools map - Global overview of yellow/white pages, court cases, business registries etc

Maps/Satellites

Satellite

5Ghz Interference locator - Tool that can help indicate military radar activity close to 5Ghz frequency - [https://medium.com/@HarelDan/x-marks-the-spot-579cdb1f534b -](https://orbtwz.users.earthengine.app/view/radarinterferencetracker)
Airbus Geostore - Platform to get a preview of their imagery and order images
Baidu Maps - Baidu’s mapping service offering satellite imagery, street maps, and streetview (“Panorama” - zh:百度全景)
Bing Maps - Microsoft Bing’s mapping service offering satellite imagery and street maps. (Streetview only appears in some countries, use a VPN and go US if it's not there)
Copernicus Open Access Hub - The site for the European Space Agency and for images from Copernicus’ six Sentinel satellites. Better resolution than Landsat. See explanation from the website GISGeography on how to download free images. - [yes -](https://scihub.copernicus.eu/)
Descartes Labs - A commercial service that collects data daily from public and commercial imagery providers. Will help journalists. “We do not charge for these requests, only ask that they are credited,” as mentioned on GIJN
DigitalGlobe - Satellite imagery vendor. Preview available via the catalogue, search tool very easy to use
DualMaps - Combines Google’s road maps, aerial view, and street view in one embeddable tool
EOS Landviewer - EOS Landviewer provides free services for up to 10 images. More images and analysis are available to journalists at a discount. Contact: Artem Seredyuk artem.seredyuk@eosda.com. EOS is in the process of developing a service provisionally called EOS Media that will be providing free images and analysis of major natural disasters
EOSDIS Worldview - Visually explore the past and the present of this dynamic planet from a satellite's perspective. Select from an array of stories below to learn more about Worldview, the satellite imagery we provide and events occurring around the world
ESA Earth Online - Consolidates European Space Agency’s earth observation data on topics such as temperature, agriculture, and ice sheets
ESA SNAP - A remote sensing program created by the European Space Agency which lets you perform various enhancements and manipulations to remotely sensed data
GeoVisual Search - Search engine that lets users visually query images for similar geographic features. The platform from Descartes Labs is built on satellite imagery from Landsat, the National Agriculture Imagery Program (NAIP), and PlanetScope. - [yes -](https://search.descarteslabs.com/?layer=naip_v2_rgb_2014-2015#lat=39.2322531&lng=-100.8544921&skipTut=true&zoom=5)
Google Earth Engine - Open-access satellite imagery and analytical framework. Virtually any satellite imagery collected from NASA, NOAA, USGS, etc. is available. Moderate and coarse resolution imagery rather than high-resolution commercial imagery. There's a learning curve with Javascript
Google Earth Pro - More functions than the web-based version. Make sure to check download additional layers, such as overlays for Bing Maps, Geonames, and Wikimapia.
How to Identify Burnt Villages through Satellite Imagery
Google Maps - Google’s mapping service offering satellite imagery, street maps, and streetview. Many 3D modelled places in Americas, Australia, Europe, N Africa, and SE Asia. Probably the easiest-to-navigate mapping service of all. No historical satellite imagery, but historic Streetview images available in many places. - [How (Not) To Report On Russian Disinformation - ](https://maps.google.com/)
GovMap - Very high res imagery for Israel/Palestine
GPSJam - Daily maps of GPS interference
HERE WeGo - More recent satellite imagery from places like Afghanistan and Iran than Google has
Hitta.se - Mapping service for Sweden
Kakao Map - Mapping service for South Korea
Mapa.sk - Mapping service for Slovakia
Mappy - Mapping service (and streetview in a couple of French cities double check this!
Pulse GHGsat - Global Methane Concentration per week
Radiant Earth - A non-profit group that helps the global development community discover, explore and analyze satellite, drone and aerial imagery archives. Radiant Earth is working with Code of Africa, among others. Apply to gain assistance via their website. Or contact Radiant Earth
satellites.pro - Combines different satellite services Includes web based Apple Maps satellite view (which has better imagery from e.g. Afghanistan than Google has, for example)
Sentinel Hub Playground - A user-friendly place for Sentinel 2/Landsat images. Updated every 5-10 days with new imagery, dependent on cloud cover. Ability to explore a variety of GIS variables eg NDVI or NDWO. The EO Browser facilitates time-lapse reviews. Generally low resolution of 10m/px. - [Using Time-Lapse Satellite Imagery To Detect Infrastructure Changes -](https://apps.sentinel-hub.com/sentinel-playground)
Soar.earth - Aerial, satellite and drone imagery on a global map
Tencent Maps - Tencent Maps (formerly SOSO Maps) is a desktop and web mapping service application and technology provided by Chinese company Tencent, offering satellite imagery, street maps, street view (coverage) and historical view perspectives
Yandex Maps - Yandex's mapping service offering satellite imagery, street maps, and streetview (“Panorama”). It also crowdsources a lot of 'streetview' imagery through the "mirror" function, from both vehicles and pedestrians

Streetview

Baidu Maps - Baidu’s mapping service offering satellite imagery, street maps, and streetview (“Panorama” - zh:百度全景)
Bing Maps - Microsoft Bing’s mapping service offering satellite imagery and street maps. (Streetview only appears in some countries, use a VPN and go US if it's not there)
Carte.ma - Mapping/streetview service for Morocco
Deckhair TV - Open webcams from hotels (??); some of them are strategically located
Echosec - Aggregated location-based searches on Twitter, VK, Foursquare
Geograph - Georeferenced images
GeoHints - Overview of different traffic lights, utility poles, bollards etc on Google Streetview
Google Earth Pro - More functions than the web-based version. Make sure to check download additional layers, such as overlays for Bing Maps, Geonames, and Wikimapia.
How to Identify Burnt Villages through Satellite Imagery
Google Maps - Google’s mapping service offering satellite imagery, street maps, and streetview. Many 3D modelled places in Americas, Australia, Europe, N Africa, and SE Asia. Probably the easiest-to-navigate mapping service of all. No historical satellite imagery, but historic Streetview images available in many places. - [How (Not) To Report On Russian Disinformation - ](https://maps.google.com/)
Hitta.se - Mapping service for Sweden
Image Hunter (Apollo Mapping) - Find available high-res images per location
KartaView (Previously Openstreetcam) - OpenStreetCam (now KartaView) is a project to collect crowdsourced street-level photographs for improving OpenStreetMap. Collected imagery is published under a CC-BY-SA license and most of the project's code is open source
Map Switcher - Chrome extension: Switch between different map services. Convert coordinates and directions and jump to the same location on another map. –
Mapillary - Crowdsourced street-level photos. A useful addition to Google StreetView. Little to no coverage in countries like Syria, Iraq, etc
Photo-Map.RU - Geotagged VK posts
Tencent Maps - Tencent Maps (formerly SOSO Maps) is a desktop and web mapping service application and technology provided by Chinese company Tencent, offering satellite imagery, street maps, street view (coverage) and historical view perspectives
Wikimapia - Crowdsourced information related to geographic locations. Possibility to switch between Google/Bing/OSM. Massive amount of UCG information. Can be laggy, and need to refresh page after a view searches. Lost Google API
Yandex Maps - Yandex's mapping service offering satellite imagery, street maps, and streetview (“Panorama”). It also crowdsources a lot of 'streetview' imagery through the "mirror" function, from both vehicles and pedestrians
YouTube location-based search - Location-based search on YouTube, but it's unclear whether it shows where it was uploaded, from which server, or only filters on keywords (e.g. “Paris” in title shows up in Paris)

Maps

(Canada) Open Database of Buildings - Database of ~4.4. million buildings in Canada (comes in GIS format) from Statistics Canada
Baidu Maps - Baidu’s mapping service offering satellite imagery, street maps, and streetview (“Panorama” - zh:百度全景)
Bing Maps - Microsoft Bing’s mapping service offering satellite imagery and street maps. (Streetview only appears in some countries, use a VPN and go US if it's not there)
converting coordinates - Convert geographic coordinates between different notation styles
DualMaps - Combines Google’s road maps, aerial view, and street view in one embeddable tool
F4Map - Global map of 3D buildings and the shadows they cast at morning, noon, evening
find2places - Allows querying Google Maps API for two specific places in precise distance from each other within given radius. Useful for geolocating photos and videos. It’s a script, no user-friendly interface
Gaode Maps - Popular mapping service in mainland China. When it comes to navigation for drivers and individuals using public transportation, Gaode Maps seems to be a better job than Baidu Maps
Geolocation Estimation - Platform that estimates image location using deep learning/AI
GeoNames - The GeoNames geographical database covers all countries and contains over eleven million place names that are available for download free of charge Extremely useful in Geo Tagging, documentation, and data collection
Geotips - Service with information (i.e., road types, sign types, license plate types, etc.) for geolocations
Gjirafa - Mapping service for Albania (specially Kosovo)
Global Forest Watch - Helps detect changes in forest cover (i.e., to track deforestation). Also includes Global Fire Watch (VIRSS data)
Google Earth Pro - More functions than the web-based version. Make sure to check download additional layers, such as overlays for Bing Maps, Geonames, and Wikimapia. - [How to Identify Burnt Villages through Satellite Imagery -](https://www.google.com/earth/download/gep/agree.html)
Google Maps - Google’s mapping service offering satellite imagery, street maps, and streetview. Many 3D modelled places in Americas, Australia, Europe, N Africa, and SE Asia. Probably the easiest-to-navigate mapping service of all. No historical satellite imagery, but historic Streetview images available in many places. - [How (Not) To Report On Russian Disinformation - ](https://maps.google.com/)
Hitta.se - Mapping service for Sweden
IndustryAbout - Maps per country showing industrial plants, e.g. power, hydroelectric, nuclear, coal, oil refineries, etc
LiveUAMap - Timeline of news and zones of control in conflict / civil unrest areas, globally
Map Switcher - Chrome extension: Switch between different map services. Convert coordinates and directions and jump to the same location on another map. –
MapChecking - This tool helps you estimate and fact-check the maximum number of people standing in a given area
mapy.cz - Mapping service for Czechia
Maritime Awareness Project (NBR) - South China Sea maps with oil and gas fields, fishing areas, air defense zones and administrative, claimed, disputed zones, submarine data cables
OGF Multimap Extension - Highlights locations from a given Wikipedia article on the OGF map
OpenInfraMap - Power lines, telecoms, solar, oil, gas & water infrastructure mapped globally
OpenSeaMap - Sea map of borders, special zones, shipping lanes, with overlays of MarineTraffic and other sources
OpenStreetMap - OpenStreetMap is a collaborative project to create a free editable map of the world. - [How Schoolchildren Became Pawns in Cameroon’s Anglophone Crisis -](https://openstreetmap.org/)
overpass-turbo - A web based data mining tool for OpenStreetMap
Peakvisor - Mountain identification tool. - [More than Mountaineering: Using PeakVisor for Geolocation, Webinars: How To Use PeakVisor, The Mountaineering App, For Open-Source Research and Using PeakVisor For Geolocations -](https://peakvisor.com/panorama.html?lat=45.9420159&lng=7.8699421&alt=4598&yaw=0.00&pitch=0.00&hfov=62.93)
QGIS - Open source GIS programme. Has many user add-ons, including creating 3D landscapes using LiDAR data. Steep learning curve. - [yes -](https://www.qgis.org/)
Radiant Earth - A non-profit group that helps the global development community discover, explore and analyze satellite, drone and aerial imagery archives. Radiant Earth is working with Code of Africa, among others. Apply to gain assistance via their website. Or contact Radiant Earth
Resource Watch - A nonprofit platform, still in beta, that provides hundreds of data sets on the state of the planet’s resources and citizens. It is sponsored by the World Resources Institute and other organizations
ShadowMap - Global map of 3D buildlings and the shadows they cast at a specific time a day
Tencent Maps - Tencent Maps (formerly SOSO Maps) is a desktop and web mapping service application and technology provided by Chinese company Tencent, offering satellite imagery, street maps, street view (coverage) and historical view perspectives
Topotijdreis.nl - Over 200 years of maps and topography from the Netherlands
TRIDENT - AI help for querying Overpass Turbo. Simply write what features you're looking for on a map
UTM grid zones
WarWire - Location-based searches on Twitter, VK, and Instagram
what3words - Entire world divided into 3m by 3m squares, and each square is given a 3 word address. For example, the what3words address for Nelson's column in trafalgar square is: cube.soccer.these. This website is especially useful when referring to remote locations and when you are unable to write down a lengthy sentence of exact coordinates
Wikimapia - Crowdsourced information related to geographic locations. Possibility to switch between Google/Bing/OSM. Massive amount of UCG information. Can be laggy, and need to refresh page after a view searches. Lost Google API
Yandex Maps - Yandex's mapping service offering satellite imagery, street maps, and streetview (“Panorama”). It also crowdsources a lot of 'streetview' imagery through the "mirror" function, from both vehicles and pedestrians

Transport

Marine

Bosphorus Observer - Ship spotting resource for vessels traversing the Bosphorus Strait
Equasis - Vessel ownership and identification records. Lists historical information. You’ll need an account to access information
FleetMon - Vessel position tracking, including a global vessel and port database. Tools for the shipping industry, Maritime News and a lively community of shipspotters. You’ll need an account to access information
Global Fishing Watch - No account needed. Identification of “dark vessels”, and includes Indonesian VMS layer
Illegal, unreported, unregular fishing Vessels List - A combined list of known illegal, unreported, unregular fishing vessels
IMO Registry - Ship/shipping-related information from the IMO
MarineTraffic - An open, community-based project, providing (near) real-time information on the movements of ships and their locations in harbours and ports. - Suez Canal: Satellite Clues on a Stricken Cargo Ship
ShipSpotting.com - Community website for uploading pictures & details of vessels spotted around the world
Tokyo MOU - Ship inspection/history database (PSC Database)
VesselFinder - Live marine vessel tracker
Winward - Platform which combines maritime-related data
SARfish - Github - SAR ship detection, by @MJ_Cruickshank

Plane

ADS-B Exchange Radar View - Live flight tracker (including many miltiary aircraft) - [A Beginner's Guide To Flight Tracking - ](https://globe.adsbexchange.com/)
ADS-B Historical Flight Viewer - Look up flight history of a specific aircraft as far back as two years. Search by ICAO number
Airfleets - Database for aircraft details
AirNav RadarBox - Live flight tracker
Aviation Safety Network - Aircraft incident database; can be searched by country, registration, year, etc
Federal Aviation Administration - Nationwide Plane Registry. Search by N-Number (a.k.a. callsign). Comprehensive list of privately owned planes in the US
FlightAware - Live flight tracker. - [Flying High: The US Connection to Venezuela’s ‘Narco-Planes’ -](https://flightaware.com/)
Flightradar24 - Tracking (civilian) flights. $ to go back in 12-month archive
https://www.airframes.org/ - A database of aircraft details
Denmark, France, Germany, Netherlands, Poland
Belgium
https://app.icarus.flights/ - Flight tracking platform with 2 years free historical data; highly customizable search parameters
Live ATC - Audio from air traffic control towers in the United States. Aircraft have to identify themselves to ATC towers, so in cases where aircraft are trying to obscure their information from other sites, it might be another way to grab tail numbers or just generally track flights. More complicated to use than e.g. Flightradar24
OpenSky-Network - Community, open source flight tracking network
PlaneFinder - Live flight tracker

Trains

Chronotrains - Map platform for checking how far you can go within five hours by train from different European destinations
OpenRailwayMap - a detailed online map of the world's railway infrastructure
Transit Visualisation - (public) transit routes visualized - near global
WikiRoutes - Public transport database
Trains - Full interactive maps of various railway networks in European countries (DEAD LINK)

Car

Carnet.AI - "API which is capable of recognizing the Make, Model and Generation of most cars built since 1995, with 97+% accuracy."
License Plate Mania - collection of license plate pictures across the world
License Plate Map (Americas) - Map of North & South America with pictures of license plates
License Plate Map (Asia & Middle East) - Map of Asia & Middle East with pictures of license plates
License Plate Map (Europe) - Map of Europe with pictures of license plates

Websites

Carbon Dating The Web - This is a simple application that estimates when a webpage was created. Unfortunately, Carbon Dating won’t show when a page was updated, only created. - GUI not working, need to go to github page
DNS Cyrillic Check - Check if malicious or Cyrillic domains are registered
DNS History - Collection of historical DNS information
Finitimus - Finitimus allows users to find the publish date for articles and other Internet content, with a click of a button
Geo IP Tools - Check your own IP, handy to check if your VPN is working
Moz Link Explorer - Analyse the links of any website
Passive DNS - Collects, stores and analyses data from thousands of passive DNS collection sensors
Shodan - Internet of things search engine
Site24x7 - Find IP address of a website
SpyOnWeb - Find out related websites via their tracking code
Vortimo - Suite of tools for website, email, WHOIS, etc. analysis
WebCookies.org - A website security and privacy scanner that, among many other features (mostly focused on GDPR compliance) aggregates large amount of information about advertiser and analytics identifiers of scanned websites, as well as the /ads.txt files
Whatcms.org - What content-management system is this website using?
WhoIs - For domain name search and information. Try either whois.net or whois.icann.org
WhoIS Domain Tools
WHOIS History - Historical WHOIS registration lookup

Crypto

BlockExplorer - Following a bitcoin trail or following a bitcoin account?
Etherscan - Tracking transactions & finding a cryptowallet each based on the ETH blockchain

Leak

How to use the Offshore Leaks Database - [How to use ICIJ's Offshore Leaks Database (part 1) (2 min) -](https://offshoreleaks.icij.org/)
How to use ICIJ's Offshore Leaks Database (part 1)
OCCRP Investigative Dashboard - Search 178 million public records and leaks from 236 sources on company and individual names
ICIJ Offshore Leaks Database - Find out who’s behind more than 810k offshore companies, foundations and trusts from the Panama Papers, the Offshore Leaks, the Bahamas Leaks and the Paradise Papers investigations.

Sanctions

OpenSanctions - Site owner: Team coordinated by Friedrich Lindenberg, funded initally by the German government - An international database of persons and companies of political, criminal, or economic interest. Combines the sanctions lists, databases of politically exposed persons, and other information about persons in the public interest into a single, dataset. Free for non-commercial users
Sanctions Explorer - Database of OFAC/UN/EU sanctions

Osint Tools Map - Worldwide map of business registries, court records and other info, by @cyb_detective

National Enterprise Credit Information Publicity System - Companies registered in China, including registered capital, legal representative, incorporation date, penalty history and business irregularity records
Court Enforcement Information Publicity - Chinese individuals and companies listed by the court as involved in dishonest practices
China Judgements Online - Judgements given out by Chinese regional courts
Cninfo - Chinese public companies financial reports and regular announcements
QCC - Private website, one of the biggest information providers, with basic registration information, shareholder structure, beneficial owners, business authorization certificates, patent information, etc

Iceland

Registry

European e-Justice portal - Site owner: European Union. Consolidates official national registers for all member states. Site might contain data not available on OpenCorporates. Fields returned: Registered office; Registration number; Company type; Business Register ID; EUID - "

Italy

Registry

Registro Imprese - The official Italian companies registry and offers a wide array of basic information and data: company’s purpose, legal email address, locations (legal HQ and operative offices or warehouses, etc). A few times it reports the date of establishment or when a company started providing a specific service/activity. It is only in Italian but has a very easy interface. The basic searching service is free, but it is possible to buy reports and specific information about a company. Same old story as for any other national registry
Info Imprese - A second database of Italian companies that basically reflects registroimprese.it. Offers the same service of registroimprese.it, but it often reports more details about a company’s activity and purpose, which can help a lot in the investigation. It is perfect to validate the results you may have previously found on registroimprese.it
Icribis.com - Great portal. Offers further information such as VAT n., Chamber of Commerce registration number, revenue range, estimate of personnel employed. Usually well kept and updated. Only “obstacle”: you have to create a socket puppet with a social security number. The basic searching service is free, but it is possible to buy reports and specific information about a company

Other

Guidamonaci.it - As much an ace of spades as a potential flop. One out of three it presents a detailed overview of a company (VAT n., Revenue, Employees, Offices, Activity, mail). Two out of three it offers some basic information and it may be able to add in some more details. Requires registration with a socket puppet. Sometimes its data and information are not up to date
Reportaziende.it - Offers detailed information about Italian companies with revenues over 5 million euro. It details revenue, net income or liabilities. The basic searching service is free, but it is possible to buy reports and specific information about a company
aziende.it - Offers pretty much the same service reportaziende.it does. Once again valid way to validate data and information gathered

Lesotho

Registry

https://www.obfc.org.ls/registry/ - Search for companies, directors and shareholders in Lesotho. Information is comprehensive and up-to-date

Registry

European e-Justice portal - Site owner: European Union. Consolidates official national registers for all member states. Site might contain data not available on OpenCorporates. Fields returned: Registered office; Registration number; Company type; Business Register ID; EUID - "

Stay Safe

Search Engines Which Protect Privacy

DuckDuckGo
StartPage
Qwant

Blur - Chrome extension - Automatically blur images and videos on a page - for when you don´t want to see images
HTTPS Everywhere - A browser add-on to force any visited sites to serve data over HTTPS (to help prevent man-in-the-middle attacks)
Malicious URL Tester - Testing unknown URLs
Panopticlick - A profiling tool which provides a measure of how easy your particular browser instance is to identify. (i.e. How much do you stand out from the crowd.) Can be used in conjunction with https://browserleaks.com/, which gives a very detailed breakdown of what your browser makes available to the outside world
Privacy Badger - A browser add-on to prevent browser tracking/cookies
Protect Yourself From Online Tracking - Privacy International's guide that recommends tools and extensions for Android, iOS, MacOS and Windows that protect you from online tracking
Security in a Box - Security in a box guide advice on how to use social media and mobile phones more safely. The Tool Guides offer step-by-step instructions to help you install, configure and use some essential digital security software and services
Security Planner (CitizenLab) - Answer a few simple questions to get personalized online safety recommendations. It's confidential - no personal information is stored and CitizenLab won't access any of your online accounts
Surveillance Self-Defense - Tips and methodologies for safe(r) online communications
Tech Solidarity - Basic Security Guide, do and don’ts for basic security when using a laptop and/or mobile device. Here’s a guide: techsolidarity.org/resources/basic_security.htm
Tella App - App for encrypting data on your phone and for securely transferring files
Two Factor Auth (2FA) - Check for every digital service you use whether you have enabled two-factor authentication (2FA)
URLscan - This is a sandbox that allows you to scan a URL to check it's safe before properly visiting it
VirusTotal - Analyze suspicious files and URLs to detect types of malware, automatically share them with the security community

Environment & Wildlife

Maps

Copernicus Atmospheric Monitoring - Global forecasts of aerosols, c02, methane, nitrogen dioxide, and others. - [What Oil, Satellite Technology and Iraq can Tell us About Pollution -](https://atmosphere.copernicus.eu/charts/cams/)
Environmental Justice Atlas - Map of environmental-related conflict globally
World Database Protected Areas - The most comprehensive global database on terrestrial and marine protected areas

Poison

FLASH Environment Assessment Tool (UNOCHA) - For identifying harmful substances and their effect on the environment after industry has been destroyed

Whale

WildMe & WildBook - Open source pattern recognition software to identify unique whales, sharks, zebras, jaguars, skunks, fish and much more

Forest

Amazonia Socio Ambiental - Amazon rainforest: maps and shapefiles of natural protected areas, concessions, indigenous territories, oil, mining, roads, fires, deforestation in bolivia, brazil, colombia, ecuador, guyanas and suriname, peru, venezuela
Brazil CAR - Cadastro Ambiental Rural - CAR is an electronic public register of scope national, mandatory for all rural properties. Cadaster of rural properties that can be explored through their owners
Global Forest Watch - Helps detect changes in forest cover (i.e., to track deforestation). Also includes Global Fire Watch (VIRSS data)
Global Palm Oil Map - Global map of Palm Oil plantations, 2019 (small holders & industrial)

Snow-Ice

CryO Tools - Scientific tools for investigating the cryosphere (areas with snow & ice)

Oil

Open Water Oil Spill Identification - PDF of US dep of Commerce to assess color/appearance and structure/distribution of oil spilled on the water

Fire

Amazon Dashboard - Tracks individual fires, and categorizes them (Savanna - small clear & agriculture - understory - deforestation)
Globel Forest Watch Fires - Fires on a global map
Satellite Detected Gas Flaring
Unitar Disaster & Damage Assessment (DEAD LINK?) - Unitar satellite imagery & maps of floodings, fires, conflict & internally displaced persons
Explosive Detonation Velocities - A wikipedia list of detonation velocities of various materials
https://twitter.com/quantian1/status/1290695231910875136

Mining

MineAlert (Oxpeckers) - Mining licenses in South Africa alongside water licenses and the threats to groundwater, mapped

Wildlife

WildEye Asia (Oxpeckers) - Seizures, arrests, court cases and convinctions related to illegal wildlife trade, in Africa and Asia Pacific, mapped
WildEye Europe (Oxpeckers) - Seizures, arrests, court cases and convinctions related to illegal wildlife trade, in Europe, mapped
Digital Dangers Map (Oxpeckers) - Online environmental crime stories, mapped

Rhino

Rhino Courtcases (Oxpeckers) - Courtcases in Southern Africa related to Rhino poaching, mapped
Rhino seizures (EIA) - Rhino incidents and traded horn, mapped globally
Poach Tracker (Oxpeckers) - Rhino death's across Southern Africa, mapped
Ivory trade (EIA) - Ivory trade in Asia & Europe, mapped
Ivory seizures (EIA) - Large scale ivory seizuers globally, mapped

Birds

Merlin - Identify birds (visually), through an app
BirdNet - Identify bird sounds - find bird sounds on a global map
Global Forest Watch (Biodiversity) - Global Forest Watch also includes maps with biodiversity hotspots, including birds and tigers
Hornbill trade (EIA) - Trafficked and seized Hornbill parts in Asia & US, mapped

Fish

Global Fishing Watch - Tracks fishing fleets
Totoaba seizures (EIA) - Map of totoaba seizures in Asia and the US, mapped

Tigers

Captive Tiger Facilities (EIA) - Captive tiger facilities implicated in trade, mapped
Global Forest Watch (Biodiversity) - Global Forest Watch also includes maps with biodiversity hotspots, including birds and tigers
Leopard Trade (EIA) - (Snow / Clouded) Leopard trade mapped
Tiger Trade (EIA) - Trade in tiger (parts) mapped

Locusts

Locust Hub (FAO) - A map visualizing locust movements globally - [How To Track Desert Locust Swarms -](https://locust-hub-hqfao.hub.arcgis.com/)

Other

Pulse GHGsat - Global Methane Concentration per week
Wind/Particulate Map - Map that visualizes wind, particulaes, and other data

Archiving

How to Archive Telegram Content to Document Russia's Invasion of Ukraine
Archive.org - Internet Archive / Wayback Machine - [How to Archive Open Source Materials - Has institutional back, and is therefore likely to stick around for a long time](https://www.bellingcat.com/resources/how-tos/2018/02/22/archive-open-source-materials/)
Archive.today - Archive any webpage, including Facebook. - Does archive Facebook and Instagram pages. - Privately owned, so what if the owner suddenly decides to take the archive offline?
Arweave - Decentralized (blockchain) archiving. - No - Decentralized. Search the public archive via site:arweave.net (not .org) - $ to archive, though 5 tokens for free
DMCA - Search takedown notices - Automates the collection of all sites visited
Dumpster Diver - Tool to search for secrets in various file types. - Easy, free and open source
Gitrob - Reconnaissance tool for GitHub organizations - Easy, free and open source
Gruber - Slideshare downloader
Hunch.ly - Research sidekick. Archives to a local drive. - No - Automates the collection of all sites visited
Perma.cc - Archiving site meant for serious, academic research to preserve citations - Relatively new, unclear what their content moderation policy is. Also doesn't work with Facebook
Pinpoint - Catalogues uploaded documents and files, providing OCR, indexing, and other services. - Incredible for data leaks and large collections of documents (PDFs, emails, DOCX, spreadsheets,etc). Works with most languages, can do OCR on scanned documents that can then be searched. Can transcribe audio files as well. - Hopefully won't be part of the Google Graveyard with other ambitious projects
Stone - A “research transparency” app that captures desktop research using screen capture and webcam commentaries.. - Free, “twitch for journalists”
TruffleHog - Searches through git repositories for high entropy strings and secrets, digging deep into commit history - Easy, free and open source
Wayback Machine Downloader - Download an entire website from the Wayback Machine. - Does not always include images from web pages or multimedia content
WITNESS - An activists guide to archiving videos
Git Wayback Machine - Finds and searches when and who did what! - Easy terminal interface.
Telegram - Guide on archiving Telegram (DEAD LINK)

First Steps to Getting Started in Open Source Research
A Beginners Guide to Social Media Verification

Guides

American Press Institute Fact-Checking Resources - Page of timely questions and vetted resources for fact checkers, with tips on how to navigate the data
Bellingcat - SGBV guide - Recognising Sexual and Gender-Based Violence as an Open Source Researcher
Bellingcat / Resources - The resources section on the website includes a large amount of guides on a variety of topics, including geolocation, using satellite imagery, and so on
Ben Strick's OSI Guide - YouTube Series from Ben Strick on how to do open source research
Berkeley Protocol - Document outlining terms, guideliness, and standards for conducting open source research for human rights investigations
First Draft News - Lots of resources on the website, including many guides, some of which have been written by Bellingcat members, including “How to Get Started in Online Investigations”
How to Maintain Mental Hygiene as an Open Source Research - Guide with practical steps and browser extensions to limit exposure to graphic content online
INHOPE hotline - Report potential child sexual abuse material (CSAM) online
Itrace (Conflict Armament Research) - lots of information on different kinds of munitions and weapons presented graphically on a map format
Verification Handbook - PDF in many languages
Washington Post - Fact-checker guide
WITNESS - Video as evidence, a guide to verifying eyewitness videos

Education

Academic Reading List - Updated list of schoarly readings on open source reearch and methods
Arxiv - Open datase of STEM articles
Berkeley Protocol - Document outlining terms, guideliness, and standards for conducting open source research for human rights investigations
Google Scholar - Search engine for scholarly literature
Setting Your Moral Compass: A Workbook for Applied Ethics in OSINT - Workbook with case studies and hands-on exercises in dealing with particularly tricky ethical questions in conducting OSINT work
Soc Arxiv - Open database of social science peer-reviewed articles
Social Media Literacy Lessons for Middle Schoolers - Open Google Drive with standalone lessons on social media literacy covering a broad range of topics (developed by a teacher in the UK for middle school-aged students)

Misc

ARES Arms & Munitions Classification - PDF - handbook designed to increase clarity and precision in how arms and munitions are defined and classified. -
Check - Collaborative fact-checking. User guide, Bellingcat’s Check team
CrownCaps - Overview of 270k+ bottlecaps, separated by country -
Dating and hook-up sites - Adult (18+) - overview of dating and hook-up sites and apps
Document Redaction - Useful for removing potentially harmful content in Pdfs before viewing, like traceback
Justice Dep't Country Research Listings -- This is the closet thing to a library on human rights, containing publications by human rights organizations and governmental organizations. For instance by: Amnesty International, Arms Conflict Report, Human Rights Watch, International Crisis Group and Freedom House. This lacks many organizations like Physicians for Human Rights.
DvidsHub - US military videos and photos, sortable by unit, branch, component etc
FAROS OSINT Resources
FAROS Terrorism Research
FBI National Stolen Art - The National Stolen Art File (NSAF) is a database of stolen art and cultural property. Stolen objects are submitted for entry to the NSAF by law enforcement agencies in the U.S. and abroad. -
Google Doc Owners - Find Google doc owners using python (xeuledoc)
Graffiti Database - Database of graffiti. Has over 38,000 entries
Insecam - Network live IP video cameras directory
Julia Angwin’s 212 data brokers - This list includes data brokers, background sites, people search tools, vital records, and criminal background check sites. - yes
Looted Art - This site contains two fully searchable databases: The information database, and the object database
Lost Art Database - Çultural objects which as a result of persecution under the Nazi dictatorship and the Second World War were relocated, moved or seized, especially from Jewish owners.
Using New Tech to Investigate Old Photographs
Lumen - Collects and analyses legal complaints and requests for removal of online materials, helping Internet users to know their rights and understand the law. This data enables us to study the prevalence of legal threats and let Internet users see the source of content removals
Maltego - Interactive data mining tool that renders directed graphs for link analysis. - There is a free version but full version costs $ - Used in online investigations for finding relationships between pieces of information from various sources located on the Internet
Modelzoo.vframe.io - detection software that can identify munitions in images and videos
Montage - For collaborative working
OpenMhz - Police and Fire scanner
OSINT CHINE - French-oriented overview of tools for doing China-related research
PhotoBuildings.com - Highres photos of buildlings, mostly eastern Europe
Ramsomware Map - Updated daily. Map of ransomeware attacks in the United Staetes. -
Samdesk - Real time breaking news/disaster monitoring (paid) - https://samdesk.io/
Swiss OSINT toolkit - Swiss-focused version of the toolkit, managed by @Zard8 -
TimelineJS by Knight Lab - Make an interactive timeline of events
Unknown Hash ID - On investigation, if you come across a hash but don’t know what it is (and warrants further investigation) this will identify the type
Wigle.net - Map of wireless networks
Wolfram|Alpha - Does a load of things, including weather forecasts per day and location. - yes
Zoopla - Search for a property with the UK's leading resource. Browse houses and flats for sale and to rent, and find estate agents in any area
